item.title: Aditus is a platform that links high-end retailers with individuals who own cryptocurrency
item.description:
Aditus is a platform designed to connect wealthy individuals who hold significant Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency assets (crypto-affluents) with luxury goods and service providers. The company identifies a gap in the market, noting that while few luxury businesses currently accept cryptocurrency, crypto-affluents are eager to use these digital assets for their purchases. Additionally, Aditus recognizes the importance of data privacy to crypto-users, which contrasts with the need for customer data in luxury marketing...

item.title: The inaugural Bitcoin conference in China will take place in May
item.description:

item.title: Is it possible that your computer is generating wealth for someone else?
item.description:
Fortinet, a leading cybersecurity company, is warning users to be alert if their computers drastically slow down, as it could be a sign of “browser cryptojacking.” This new cybercrime involves hackers secretly using victims’ computers to mine Monero, a type of cryptocurrency. This is how it works: a malicious script is secretly embedded into a website. When a user visits the site, the script uses their computer’s processing power to mine Monero for the cybercriminal...

item.title: Trade cryptocurrency with Wowoo in Singapore
item.description:
Wowoo Exchange, a digital asset trading platform based in Singapore, has been launched. The platform initially targets the local market and enables users to trade cryptocurrency using Singapore dollars (SGD) for deposits and withdrawals. Initially, three currency pairs are offered: SGD-Bitcoin, SGD-Ethereum, and Bitcoin-Ethereum, with plans to introduce more pairings in the future. New users who sign up on the platform are eligible for sign-up bonuses. Wowoo Exchange facilitates convenient trading experiences with features such as Singapore-dollar transactions, market and limit orders...
